subject: Re: [junit] Re: How to test private methods in a class.
msgSnippet: ... Why would you ever think you have to make that choice? You don t. All reachable code, including private code, can be tested through the published
messageBody:
Robert Wenner wrote:

> If I am to decide whether I want tested (i.e. known to work) code, or a
> small public (or even published) interface, I clearly go for the former.

Why would you ever think you have to make that choice? You don't. All
reachable code, including private code, can be tested through the
published interface. Any code that can't be so tested can be deleted
without reducing functionality.

--
